input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Mycoplasma genitalium

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 28 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Abnormal vaginal discharge
- Burning sensation when peeing (dysuria)
- Leaking fluid from the penis (note: as a female, I won't have penile discharge, so I will focus on vaginal symptoms)
- Painful urination
- Vaginal itching
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
They started about a week ago, initially just noticing some increased vaginal discharge that was different from my usual. Over the past few days, I’ve also experienced a burning sensation when I urinate and some discomfort during urination. I’ve noticed the discharge has become more noticeable and slightly cloudy. I don’t have any fever or other systemic symptoms, but I’m worried because I’ve had multiple partners recently without protection. I’m feeling a bit anxious about what this could be and want to get checked out as soon as possible.

ANSWER: Umm, I’ve been having this unusual vaginal discharge for about a week now, and it’s different from what I normally have. I also feel this burning when I pee, and it’s kind of painful, like, I don’t know, really sharp sometimes. There’s also this itching, and I feel like I might be leaking some fluid, I guess from there. I’m just really worried because I’ve had a few partners recently, and I don’t want it to be anything serious.

answer: Umm, I’ve been having this unusual vaginal discharge for about a week now, and it’s different from what I normally have. I also feel this burning when I pee, and it’s kind of painful, like, I don’t know, really sharp sometimes. There’s also this itching, and I feel like I might be leaking some fluid, I guess from there. I’m just really worried because I’ve had a few partners recently, and I don’t want it to be anything serious.
